thread.title: Arsenal vs Bayern Munich: Francis Coquelin actually chose to show Arjen Robben onto his left foot | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal vs Bayern Munich: Francis Coquelin actually chose to show Arjen Robben onto his left foot | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal vs Bayern Munich: Francis Coquelin actually chose to show Arjen Robben onto his left foot | Metro News
text:
Follow us Francis Coquelin actually chose to show Arjen Robben onto his left foot for Bayern Munich’s opener Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 8:13 pm Arjen Robben put Bayern Munich ahead with a stunning goal (Picture: Getty) 
Everyone knows Arjen Robben wants to cut in onto his left foot, right? 
Well, everyone other than Francis Coquelin – it would seem. 
Arsene Wenger stressed the importance of staying tight defensively in the first-leg against Bayern Munich but the Gunners were 1-0 down after just ten minutes when Robben curled in a beautiful effort from 25 yards. 
The former Chelsea winger remains one of the best players in the world and he’s a handful for any defence but Coquelin hardly made it difficult for the notoriously one-footed Dutchman when he showed Robben onto his left foot at the edge of the box. 
— Giga Grievi (@GigaGrievi) February 15, 2017 
Coquelin was closing the space that Phillip Lahm was occupying down the right flank but the danger was in the middle and Robben punished the midfielder’s sloppiness with a spectacular effort from range.
